result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott James Davis

defendant.name: Davis, Scott James
defendant.address: 33 S Geneva Ave, Sturgeon Bay, WI 54235

records.addlTxt: Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

3:24 PM Defendant Scott James Davis appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney George Steve Pappas Jr. appeared by video for Scott James Davis.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file. Questions where matter is at. Atty Pappas indicates still feels close to resolution requests another date.  State has no objection.  Bond remains in effect.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:45 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 17, 2022 at 03:15 pm.

1:51 PM Defendant Scott James Davis appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney George Steve Pappas Jr. appeared by video for Scott James Davis.  Prosecuting attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reviews events in file, questions where matter is at.  Atty Pappas indicates close to resolution, requests plea/sentencing be scheduled. State has no objection. Bond remains in effect.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 03:15 pm.
Status conference on September 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Defense waives reading of Information and enters not guilty plea. Bond remains in effect.

3:31 PM Defendant Scott James Davis in court, in custody.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney George Steve Pappas Jr. in court for Scott James Davis.  Defense waives right to Prelim. Court questions defendant on waiver. Court finds waiver made freely and voluntarily, accepts waiver and binds over for trial. Court finds probable cause for bindover.
Status conference scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 01:45 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 02:45 pm.

Court amends no contact to no violent contact with K.G.D.  Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia. Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release. Drug Monitoring.

8:30 AM  Defendant Scott James Davis appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney George Steve Pappas Jr. appeared by video for Scott James Davis.   Court reviews events in file.  Defense waives reading of the complaint, waives time limits for prelim.  Atty Pappas to contact JA Parks to set prelim. date. Bond remains in effect.  Back in session 8:44 am.  Appearances are the same except for Atty Pappas who does not appear.  Court questions defendant on bond modification. Defendant indicates he's comfortable proceeding without his attorney being present.  Victim requests the no contact be lifted, makes statement. State takes no position. Court makes statement, amends no contact with K.G.D to no violent contact.  All other conditions remain in effect as previously set.
Order Appointing Counsel
Adjourned initial appearance on July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

1:15 PM   Defendant Scott James Davis appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.   Court reviews events in file, reviews defendants petition for court appointed counsel.  Court indicates the clerk has contacted a few attorney's and hasn't found one willing to take the case yet.  Clerk has emailed Atty George Pappas and is awaiting a response to see if he'll take a court appointment.  If Atty Pappas doesn't take the case, clerk will then contact Atty Randall Petrouske to see if he's willing to take the case.  Court adjourns matter for today with the hopes of having an attorney in place by the next hearing.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

records.descr: Pet for appointment counsel,affidavit of indigency

records.addlTxt: Per Kylie at SPD office, defendant does not qualify for their representation, advises defendant has too much equity in his house.  Kylie advised that defendant would be requesting court appointed counsel.  Per Judge Ehlers, send petition for appointment of attorney form to the jail for defendant to fill out.  LS sent form to the jail on todays date.

11:30 AM  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Scott James Davis appeared by video.   Court reviews events in file, questions defendant if he's talked to SPD office to see if he qualifies.   Defendant indicates he's tried contacting SPD office and hasn't been able to get through to them.  Atty Viel is present in court, will either stop at the jail to talk to defendant or have his office get in contact with defendant.  Court reschedules matter.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:37 AM  Prosecuting attorney Nicholas Paul Grode in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Scott James Davis appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Court reviews events in file, questions defendant on whether he's contacted SPD regarding legal representation.  Court will have clerk contact SPD to see if defendant qualifies or not.  Bond remains in effect.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 11:30 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Defendant was fingerprinted 6/13/22.

Victim requests Court lift the no contact with defendant.  State strongly opposes request, makes statement.  Victim responds to State's comments.  Court makes statement, denies request to modify bond, remains in effect as previously set.

11:06 AM  Defendant Scott James Davis appeared by video from the Door County Jail.  Attorney Colleen Catherine Nordin in court for State of Wisconsin.  Atty Viel indicates defendant previously refused SPD representation, indicates if he wishes to see if he qualifies, he'll have to contact their office.  Court reviews charge(s), max. penalties, right to counsel, right to prelim.  Defendant now wishes to contact SPD to see if he qualifies.  Court adjourns matter to give defendant time to talk to SPD.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Search warrant, Return of Officer, Acknowledgement of return of Officer
Search warrant, Return of Officer, Acknowledgment of return of Officer.
No Contact Modification Request.

Pretrial Release Monitoring Program: Must be enrolled and equipment activated prior to release -  Drug Monitoring. No contact direct or indirect with K.G.D, her residence or place of employment. Not to possess or consume any controlled substances without a valid prescription and then take only in the amount and frequency prescribed. Not to possess or use any drug paraphernalia.
1:00PM State gives incident report, potential charges. Court questions Defendant on address/employment history, reviews right to Counsel. Court finds probable cause, sets bond. Return June 20, 2022.
